Name: familial adenomatous polyposis
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease that has_material_basis_in mutations in the APC gene and involves formation of numerous polyps in the epithelium of the large intestine which are initially benign and later transform into colon cancer.

Name: Weill-Marchesani syndrome
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease characterized by short stature

Name: Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease that is a genetically heterogeneous encephalopathy characterized in its most severe form by cerebral atrophy

Name: brachydactyly-syndactyly syndrome
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease that is characterized by brachydactyly and syndactyly

Name: autosomal dominant disease
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease that is characterized by the presence of one disease-associated mutation of a gene which is sufficient to cause the disease.

Name: autosomal recessive disease
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease that is characterized by the presence of two mutated copies of the gene

Name: Matthew-Wood syndrome
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease that is characterized by microphthalmia or anophthalmia

Name: septooptic dysplasia
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease characterized by the classical triad of optic nerve hypoplasia

Name: camptodactyly-tall stature-scoliosis-hearing loss syndrome
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease characterized by camptodactyly

Name: hereditary desmoid disease
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease characterized by extraintestinal manifestation of familial adenomatous polyposis that has_material_basis_in in some cases by extreme 3' mutation in APC on 5q22.2.

Name: McCune Albright syndrome
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease that is characterized by polyostotic fibrous dysplasia

Name: factor XI deficiency
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease that is characterized by deficiency of factor XI clotting factor and mild prolonged bleeding
